src\\components\\ActionMenu.tsx.description: The Action Menu on the top right of a page. You can place Actions here which are in context of the current page.

hideToggleAction.description: Hides the toggle button in mobile view. Can be useful when using multiple ActionMenus and not show the toggle button for each menu.

toggleIcon.description: Icon component for the toggle icon.

src\\components\\ActionMenu.tsx.exampleCode:

src\\components\\Body.tsx.description: Contains the content of the page.

containerClass.description: Class name for the container. More info: https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/layout/overview/#containers

hasActions.description: Set `true` if this page uses `<Actions />`, so this component will get enough padding to avoid overlapping of the content.

mirrored.description: By default the caret points to the right when closed. Set mirrored and it will point to the left.

src\\components\\HeaderTitle.tsx.description:
The title area at the header bar.
Depending on its content, the document's title will be set aswell (what will be shown in the browser title bar).

logo.description: Can be an image. Will be placed inside of the `src` attribute.

keepAppTitle.description: Disables that the app title will disappear at a specific view width.

sidebar.description: Is the component used on the sidebar?

src\\components\\IconMenuItem.tsx.description:
Variant of `MenuItem` to primarily display an icon without a label.
The label prop will be displayed as a tooltip.

tooltipClass.description: Tooltip will be placed to the end/right by default. You can change the direction with this prop.

horizontalOnOpenSidebar.description:
When used inside of the sidebar: active indicator will be displayed underneath instead of before.
The prop to `false` to disable this behavior.

src\\components\\Intro.tsx.description: Can be used for a sign-in page.

logo.description: Can be an image. Will be placed inside of the `src` attribute.

title.description: Text which will be placed under the logo.

src\\components\\Layout.tsx.description:
The main component. As soon this component is mounted, it is globally available under `window.blueLayoutRef`.
You can also append your own event listeners.

Allowed events:

* **componentDidUpdate** - Component was updated.
  Example: `window.blueLayoutRef.addEventListener("componentDidUpdate", (prevProps, prevState) => { })`
* **pageDidShowAgain** - Page appeared again with the same old state. In the callback function you can reinitialize things.
  Example: `window.blueLayoutRef.addEventListener("pageDidShowAgain", "home", (prevProps, prevState) => { })`
* **pageDidHide** - This page disappeared and another page appears instead.
  Example: `window.blueLayoutRef.addEventListener("pageDidHide", "home", (prevProps, prevState) => { })`

Method to add event listeners:
* `window.blueLayoutRef.`**addEventListener**`(eventName: string, param2: any, param3: any, listenerId?: string)`

Methods to remove event listeners:
* `window.blueLayoutRef.`**removeEventListener**`(eventName: string, listenerId: string)`
* `window.blueLayoutRef.`**removeDuplicatedEventListeners**`()` - Will automatically be called when running `addEventListener`

sidebarIn.description:
By default, the side bar is "in".
You can control the state from outside, by also using `onChangeSidebarIn`.

onChangeSidebarIn.description: React to changes of the `sidebarIn` state.

hideToggleExpandSidebar.description: Set `true` to hide button to toggle `expandSidebar` state.

expandSidebar.description: Sidebar is automatically expanded on wider views.

onChangeExpandSidebar.description: React to changes of the `expandSidebar` state.

pages.description: Registers pages for the built-in routing system. Example: `[{name: "home", component: <HomePage />}]`

unrouteable.description: When `true`, always the "home" route will be rendered.

disableTitleSet.description: By default, the document title will automatically set. Set this prop to `true` to disable this behaviour.

sidebarToggleIconComponent.description: If you don't use blueicon, you can define another icon element for the sidebar toggle button.

enableStatus.description:
Set `true` if you want to use the Utilities functions for status and alert.
Set `false` if you want to use `StatusProvider` instead.

tsType.name: signature

statusIcons.description:
Will replace status icons with custom ones. This will also overwrite the `useBlueicons` option.
This can be a SVG component or a normal element component.

disableHeaders.description: Disables the header bars on pages.

blockRouting.description:
Define a function, that will be fired when switching routes. When your function returns `true`, the default route behaviour will be blocked.
You can use something like `window.blueLayoutRef.setState({ blockRouting: onHashChange })` globally to set the value from anywhere in your app.

src\\components\\MenuItem.tsx.description: Link, button or custom component for Sidebar, Actions or ActionMenu

to.description: Sets `to` prop, e.g. when you use the `NavLink` component from React Router.

exact.description: Prop for components by React Router.

icon.description: Icon component or a class name.

iconClassName.description: Addition to class name of icon wrapper element

iconForActive.description: Icon component or a class name when the MenuItem is active.

highlighted.description: Set true to highlight the current menu item.

isHome.description: When using Blue React's routing system: define this link as home page link.

dropdownClassName.description: Extends class name of the dropdown menu.

children.description: Set children to create a nested `MenuItem` as a dropdown.

elementType.description:
By default, MenuItem is a `"button"`. If you set a `href`, it's a `"a"`.
If you want to have it another type, you can pass a component reference with this prop (e.g. `Link`).

onDragStart.description: Fired on the draggable target (the source element): occurs when the user starts to drag an element

onDrag.description: Fired on the draggable target (the source element): occurs when an element is being dragged

onDragEnd.description: Fired on the draggable target (the source element): occurs when the user has finished dragging the element

onDragEnter.description: Fired on the drop target: occurs when the dragged element enters the drop target

onDragOver.description: Fired on the drop target: occurs when the dragged element is over the drop target

onDragLeave.description: Fired on the drop target: occurs when the dragged element leaves the drop target

onDrop.description: Fired on the drop target: occurs when the dragged element is dropped on the drop target

draggable.description: Specifies whether an element is draggable or not.

disabled.description: Specifies whether an element is disabled or not.

src\\components\\Modal.tsx.description:
Simple modal/dialog. Designed to work as an alternative to JavaScript's native `alert()`, `prompt()` and `confirm()` functions.
It uses Bootstrap's Modal components.

For easy use, you should use the hook `useModal` together with `ModalProvider`. See the example there.

onSubmit.description:
Type of `input` depends on `type` prop and which action occured.
When it's a string, the user entered something. When it's a boolean, the user clicked "Yes" or "No".
When it's `null`, the user cancelled the modal.

src\\components\\Outside.tsx.description: Component that fires an event if you click outside of it

title.description: Will be set to the document's `<title>` tag.

src\\components\\Search.tsx.description: A search bar that can be placed to the sidebar or on a page.

body.description: Is component inside of a page?

resetIcon.description: Define custom icon for the reset button.

sidebar.description: Is component inside of the sidebar?

inputRef.description: Set `ref` prop of the input element. Let's you take control of it from the outside, e.g. to set focus.

sidebarClass.description: Extends the class name by the sidebar.

sidebarStyle.description: Sets the `style` prop by the sidebar.

menuClass.description: Extends the class name by the menu.

menuStyle.description: Sets the `style` prop by the menu.

topContent.description: Content on top of the menu.

bottomContent.description: Content for the bottom part of the sidebar.

src\\components\\SidebarMenuItem.tsx.description:
Extends `MenuItem` with following features:
* Shows provided label as tooltip if sidebar is closed.
* Children will be displayed on the right side of the parent item.

**Important!** Set the following props to the surrounding `SidebarMenu` to provide problems with tooltips:
```jsx
<SidebarMenu
    sidebarClass="overflow-visible"
    menuClass="overflow-visible"
>
    ...
</SidebarMenu>
```

src\\components\\SidebarToggler.tsx.description: Button to toggle sidebar state. Designed for internal use inside of `Layout`.

src\\components\\SlimContainer.tsx.description: Shortcut for a combination using Bootstrap's Grid System to create a slim responsive container.

src\\components\\Switch.tsx.description:
@deprecated
Use Bootstrap's `.form-check.form-switch` instead:
https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.2/forms/checks-radios/#switches

For now, this component acts as proxy for Bootstrap's Switch.
To place a label next to the switch, use the new `label` prop.

Migrate to Blue React 8.4.0 and use legacy support: Set the `label` with a string. Or set the `legacy` prop to use the previous look and behaviour.

sliderLabel.description: Sets label inside of the switch. If you set this, you should also set the className "lg" to make the switch larger.

elementType.description: You can change the type of the wrapper element. If you do, the `onChange` event might not be triggered.

legacy.description: Set prop to use the older look and feel. Will disappear in future releases.
